title: Trump Shares Tweet Naming Alleged Whistleblower
summary: Whistleblower complaint set off congressional investigation that led to president's impeachment.

title: Small Plane Crash Kills Five in Louisiana
summary: Jet was en route to Peach Bowl playoff game in Atlanta between LSU and Oklahoma. ATLANTA-A small plane en route to a college-football game crashed into the parking lot of a post office in Louisiana shortly after takeoff on Saturday, killing five people, authorities said.

title: Rocket Attack in Iraq Kills U.S. Contractor, Wounds Four U.S. Troops
summary: U.S. hasn't assigned blame but is focusing on militia backed by Iran. A U.S. contractor was killed and four U.S. troops were wounded when more than 30 rockets were fired Friday at an Iraqi military base, a U.S. defense official said.

title: More Workers Eligible for Overtime Pay in 2020
summary: Labor Department rule change is first in over 15 years, but critics say it still doesn't go far enough. More workers will qualify for overtime in the new year under the first federal overhaul of requirements in more than 15 years, an update businesses are taking in stride but that is leaving some workers frustrated they won't see bigger paychecks.

title: Motorists Scorn North Carolina's First Public-Private Toll Road
summary: Suburban Charlotte residents boycott new express lanes, call for state to take over. CORNELIUS, N. C.-After four years of construction and commuter complaints, the I-77 Express lanes meant to alleviate congestion in Charlotte's booming suburbs are open and collecting tolls.

title: Lasagna: New York's Hot Food Trend for 2020
summary: The Italian comfort food is among the items likely to be fashionable on New York menus in the new year. As we reach the end of 2019, it is fair to say that most diners throughout the New York metropolitan area have had their fill of plant-based burgers and fast-food chicken sandwiches, to name two of this year's popular items.

title: Lingering Economic Risks Put Gold on Track for Best Year Since 2010
summary: The precious metal's price has hit its highest level in three months. Gold is on track to post its best annual performance since 2010, underscoring how a host of global economic challenges are supporting the haven metal even as stocks rally to new highs.

title: The Year Genre-Bending Artists Took Over Pop Music
summary: With genre-blurring acts like Lil Nas X, Billie Eilish and Lizzo on the rise, old categories are losing their meaning.

title: The State That Keeps Producing Star Quarterbacks
summary: Georgia natives Justin Fields and Trevor Lawrence are products of the explosion of 7-on-7 passing leagues and private position coaching in the state. It's only 18 miles between the suburban Atlanta hometowns of quarterbacks Justin Fields of Ohio State and Trevor Lawrence of Clemson. On Saturday, 1,847 miles west in Glendale, Ariz., the pair will face off in the Fiesta Bowl with a trip to the national championship on the line.

title: Wireless Companies Share the Airwaves
summary: New cellular service lets the military, companies and others use the same frequencies-provided they don't interfere with each other. Acquiring cellular spectrum is expensive, so the federal government is trying a new system to put some of its frequencies to work more cheaply: Let companies share space with the Navy.

title: Investors Look to the Yen for Dollar, Euro Insight
summary: Some say the Japanese currency offers a glimpse of what awaits other developed money markets. This article is part of the Journal's quarterly markets review. This quarter's review analyzes Japan's bear market three decades after it started.

title: 'Illusions of the Photographer: Duane Michals at the Morgan' Review: A Self-Curated Retrospective
summary: The wittily eclectic photographer is both the creator and the subject of this exhibit, which features his own work alongside objects chosen from the Morgan's archives.. New York

title: Pastor's Mission: Shield U.S.-Visa Seeking Migrants From Violence in Mexico
summary: Resume Subscription. NUEVO LAREDO, Mexico-Every morning, Lorenzo Ortíz, a Baptist pastor who lives in Texas, drives a 12-seat passenger van packed with food and blankets across the border to pick up migrants who have been dropped off in Mexico and ferry them to shelters.

title: As China's Troubles Mushroom, Xi Collects a Special Title
summary: The Politburo's use of "people's leader" signals the leader retains a firm grip on power despite challenges at home and abroad. HONG KONG-China's President Xi Jinping received lavish praise and a new leadership title from his top Communist Party lieutenants, the clearest signal yet that he retains a firm grip on power despite policy setbacks in the past year.

title: China to Price Existing Loans With New Benchmark Lending Rates
summary: New rates are seen as more responsive to market movements. BEIJING-China's central bank moved another step toward interest-rate liberalization by asking banks to price outstanding loans with new benchmark rates that are seen as more responsive to market movements.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: PG&E: Wired to Fail
summary: Resume Subscription. PG&E Corp. Chief Executive Tony Earley liked the idea the minute he heard it. He would change the signature line on company emails-"PG&E is committed to protecting our customers' privacy"- to promote safety instead.

title: Why the White Wine Spritzer Is a Wise Choice for Holiday Imbibing
summary: Get over your snobbery and embrace this buoyant beauty of a beverage. OK, OENOPHILES. Message received, master mixologists. We get it: You believe the wine spritzer is beneath you. "It just seems so plain. So safe. So suburban. So unimaginative," wrote Craig Lane, head bartender and manager of Bar Agricole in San Francisco, in a recent email exchange. "Maybe we have also absorbed some subconscious bias from the Bartles & Jaymes days of pre-bottled wine spritzers."

title: Five Ways to Fix PG&E
summary: Suggestions from industry executive, regulators and experts for ways the giant utility can safely keep the lights on. Scores of people dead. Billions of dollars in property damage. A century-old company's reputation in tatters.

title: Candidates Prepare Closing Arguments in Final Days of 2019
summary: Warren looks to pivot away from health care; Klobuchar rallies Iowans to get off the sidelines. The start of the new year will initiate the closing-arguments phase of the Democratic primary, with the first nominating contest, in Iowa, now only about a month away.

title: Should Germany Rebuild Its Past?
summary: Efforts to reconstruct destroyed landmarks raise questions about how to honor a history that bore the seeds of Nazism.. With its polished cobblestones and palatial facades, Old Market Square in Potsdam, Germany-a well-heeled suburb of Berlin that was once the summer retreat of Prussia's kings-seems to be straight out of the baroque era. But the patina of age is an illusion. The towering St. Nicholas Church is a 1981 reconstruction. The city's former imperial palace, now home to the regional parliament, was finished in 2013.
